title: Understanding Antisocial Personality Disorder
text: Antisocial personality disorder is often misunderstood. It is not just about being unsociable or introverted. It involves a deeper pattern of behavior.

title: Key Characteristics
text: Consider the key characteristics of antisocial personality disorder. It involves a pattern of behavior that disregards the rights of others.

title: Age of Onset
text: Antisocial personality disorder typically begins in childhood or early adolescence and continues into adulthood.

hintAnswer: a pervasive pattern of disregard for, and violation of, the rights of others that begins in childhood or early adolescence and continues into adulthood
title: Identifying the Correct Pattern
text: Which of the following best describes antisocial personality disorder?
choices: idea that one can influence the outcome of specific events by doing something that has no bearing on the circumstances
a pervasive pattern of disregard for, and violation of, the rights of others that begins in childhood or early adolescence and continues into adulthood
a pervasive pattern of instability of interpersonal relationships, $$self-image$$, and affects, and marked impulsivity that begins by early adulthood and is present in a variety of contexts
a pattern of pervasive and excessive emotionality and $$attention-seeking$$ behavior that begins by early adulthood and is present in a variety of contexts
